question: Which club does Abdul Manaf Mamat currently play for?

content.source_1:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Malaysian Football Star Abdul Manaf Mamat Joins Kelantan F.C. Kota Bharu, Kelantan, Malaysia - In a move that is set to shake up the Malaysian football scene, Abdul Manaf Mamat, a seasoned Malaysian football player, has officially joined Kelantan F.C., a professional football association based in Kota Bharu, Kelantan, Malaysia. According to sources close to the team, Mamat, who has had a stellar career in Malaysian football, signed a multi-year contract with Kelantan F.C. earlier this week. The move is seen as a major coup for the team, which has been looking to bolster its squad ahead of the upcoming season. "We are thrilled to have Abdul Manaf Mamat on board," said Kelantan F.C. 's team manager, Datuk Rosmadi Ismail, in an exclusive interview. "He brings a wealth of experience and skill to our team, and we are confident that he will be a valuable asset to us in the coming season." Mamat, who has played for several top-tier teams in Malaysia, including Pahang F.C. and Terengganu F.C., is known for his lightning-fast speed and clinical finishing ability. He has also represented the Malaysian national team on several occasions, scoring crucial goals in international competitions. "I am excited to join Kelantan F.C. and contribute to the team's success," Mamat said in a statement. "I am looking forward to working with the coaching staff and my new teammates to bring glory to the team and our fans." Data from the Malaysian Football League (MFL) shows that Mamat has scored over 50 goals in his professional career, making him one of the top scorers in the league. His impressive stats and experience are expected to be a major boost to Kelantan F.C. 's chances of winning the league title this season. Kelantan F.C. has been on a upward trajectory in recent years, finishing in the top four of the Malaysian Super League last season. The addition of Mamat to the team is seen as a key factor in their bid to win the title this season. "Abdul Manaf Mamat is a top-class player who will undoubtedly strengthen our team," said Kelantan F.C. 's head coach, B. Sathianathan. "We are confident that he will fit in seamlessly with our playing style and help us achieve our goals this season."
content.source_2: As the sun dipped into the horizon, casting a warm orange glow over the small town of Coleraine, the streets began to buzz with excitement. The local football club, Coleraine F.C., was gearing up for their biggest match of the season, and the townspeople were eager to show their support. Among the sea of blue and white jerseys, one player stood out - Abdul Manaf Mamat, the Malaysian midfielder with a reputation for his lightning-fast footwork and uncanny ability to read the game. As Abdul made his way to the stadium, he couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and belonging. It had been a few months since he joined the team, and he had quickly become a fan favorite. The locals had taken to calling him "The Malaysian Magician," and his name was often chanted in unison as he took to the pitch. As he changed into his kit, Abdul's thoughts turned to his family back in Malaysia. He had left behind a comfortable life to pursue his dream of playing professional football in Europe, and it had been a tough road. But the warm welcome he had received from the people of Coleraine had made it all worth it. As the team took to the pitch for their pre-match warm-up, Abdul's eyes met those of his captain, a grizzled veteran named Jamie. Jamie gave him a nod of encouragement, and Abdul felt a surge of adrenaline. This was it - this was what he had been working towards. The match was a nail-biter, with both teams creating scoring opportunities left and right. But in the end, it was Abdul's quick thinking and agility that made the difference. He intercepted a pass in midfield and launched a counter-attack, beating two defenders before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. The crowd erupted, and Abdul's teammates mobbed him in celebration. As he grinned from ear to ear, the chant of "Malaysian Magician" echoed through the stadium once more. It was moments like these that made Abdul know he had made the right decision in joining Coleraine F.C.
